clusters.neutral_headline: One hundred abducted schoolchildren released in Nigeria

items.title: One hundred abducted schoolchildren released in Nigeria
items.standfirst: Details of the release of the schoolchildren are still unclear and 165 people remain unaccounted for.
items.content: Details of the release of the schoolchildren are still unclear and 165 people remain unaccounted for.

items.title: Nigeria Wins Release of 100 Schoolchildren Kidnapped Last Month
Nigeria secures release of 100 kidnapped children, reports say
items.standfirst: At least 153 students and 12 teachers taken from a Catholic school last month remain in captivity.
items.content: At least 153 students and 12 teachers taken from a Catholic school last month remain in captivity.

items.title: Nigerian state secures release of 100 out of 265 kidnapped schoolchildren
items.standfirst: Gunmen abducted 315 pupils and staff last month from St Mary’s school in Niger state as part of spate of kidnappingsNigerian authorities have secured the release of 100 kidnapped schoolchildren taken by gunmen from a Catholic school last month, a UN source and local media said on Sunday, though the fate of another 165 students and staff thought to remain in captivity remained unclear.In November 315 students and staff were kidnapped from St Mary’s co-educational boarding school in north-central Niger state, as the country buckled under a wave of mass abductions reminiscent of the infamous 2014 Boko Haram abduction of schoolgirls in Chibok. Continue reading...
items.content: Gunmen abducted 315 pupils and staff last month from St Mary’s school in Niger state as part of spate of kidnappingsNigerian authorities have secured the release of 100 kidnapped schoolchildren taken by gunmen from a Catholic school last month, a UN source and local media said on Sunday, though the fate of another 165 students and staff thought to remain in captivity remained unclear.In November 315 students and staff were kidnapped from St Mary’s co-educational boarding school in north-central Niger state, as the country buckled under a wave of mass abductions reminiscent of the infamous 2014 Boko Haram abduction of schoolgirls in Chibok. Continue reading...

items.title: Nigerian government secures release of 100 abducted schoolchildren - reports
items.standfirst: Nigeria's government has secured the release of 100 schoolchildren who were abducted from a Catholic boarding school last month, according to local media.
items.content: Nigeria's government has secured the release of 100 schoolchildren who were abducted from a Catholic boarding school last month, according to local media.

items.title: Thailand launches airstrikes along disputed border with Cambodia as tensions flare
items.standfirst: Escalation follows killing of Thai soldier and four Cambodian civilians weeks after Trump-brokered ceasefireThailand has launched airstrikes along its disputed border with Cambodia after both countries accused each other of breaching a ceasefire deal brokered by Donald Trump.Four Cambodian civilians and at least one Thai soldier have been killed in the renewed clashes, which have forced tens of thousands of people to flee their homes. Continue reading...
items.content: Escalation follows killing of Thai soldier and four Cambodian civilians weeks after Trump-brokered ceasefireThailand has launched airstrikes along its disputed border with Cambodia after both countries accused each other of breaching a ceasefire deal brokered by Donald Trump.Four Cambodian civilians and at least one Thai soldier have been killed in the renewed clashes, which have forced tens of thousands of people to flee their homes. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: Ukraine’s president says latest discussions on peace proposals with US were ‘constructive, although not easy’See all our Ukraine war coverageVolodymyr Zelenskyy will meet the leaders of the UK, France and Germany in London on Monday to discuss the latest US-authored peace proposal aimed at ending Russia’s war in Ukraine.Days of negotiations between US and Ukrainian officials ended on Saturday without an apparent breakthrough. The Ukrainian president called the discussions “constructive, although not easy”. Continue reading...

items.title: Anglo American drops plan to pay bosses millions in bonuses after $50bn Teck merger backlash
items.standfirst: FTSE 100 miner’s U-turn follows investor opposition to payouts when deal completes, including estimated £8.5m to CEOBusiness live – latest updatesLondon-listed miner Anglo American has dropped plans to award its bosses multimillion-pound bonuses if its planned $50bn mega-merger with a Canadian rival goes through, after a backlash from its investors.The FTSE 100 miner had sought shareholder approval for a plan to award its chief executive, Duncan Wanblad, a share bonus worth £8.5m if the deal to buy Teck Resources to create a copper producing giant was completed. Continue reading...
items.content: FTSE 100 miner’s U-turn follows investor opposition to payouts when deal completes, including estimated £8.5m to CEOBusiness live – latest updatesLondon-listed miner Anglo American has dropped plans to award its bosses multimillion-pound bonuses if its planned $50bn mega-merger with a Canadian rival goes through, after a backlash from its investors.The FTSE 100 miner had sought shareholder approval for a plan to award its chief executive, Duncan Wanblad, a share bonus worth £8.5m if the deal to buy Teck Resources to create a copper producing giant was completed. items.title: Research Veteran Yardeni Ends 15-Year Tech Bet With Underweight Mag 7 Call
Yardeni Discusses Shift on Magnificent Seven Tech Stocks
items.standfirst: Veteran strategist Ed Yardeni, president of Yardeni Research, talks to Bloomberg Television about his shift to underweight Magnificent Seven tech stocks. He says he recommends "broadening out" portfolios as "there's still plenty of good stocks out there of companies that are going to be using all these technologies." (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Veteran strategist Ed Yardeni, president of Yardeni Research, talks to Bloomberg Television about his shift to underweight Magnificent Seven tech stocks. He says he recommends "broadening out" portfolios as "there's still plenty of good stocks out there of companies that are going to be using all these technologies." (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Research Veteran Yardeni Ends 15-Year Tech Bet With Underweight Mag 7 Call

items.content: Yardeni Research now recommends effectively going underweight the Magnificent Seven megacap technology stocks versus the rest of the S&P 500, expecting a shift in earnings growth ahead.
